translation.ja: 風邪？ いえ　違う

translation.en: -Mmm. What is that? -It's all good. I've got it. You can get it next time.
translation.ja: 今日は払うよ　次は君が

translation.en: What makes you think there's gonna be a next time?
You keep following me all around town.
[giggles] You keep telling yourself that.
But thank you.
You're welcome.
Ladies first.
What about you? Beechwood Downs your whole life?
translation.ja: ずっとこの町に居るの？

translation.en: Oh, I did an OE. An overseas experience. I lived in London for a year,
translation.ja: 海外に住んだこともある ロンドンに１年と―

translation.en: and then spent a few years at uni in Australia.
translation.ja: 大学時代は オーストラリアに居た

translation.en: Ah, there's more to this provincial chippy than the lady suspected, huh?
translation.ja: 田舎の大工にしては 経験豊かだろ

translation.en: Ah, no, I was... You know what? I'm gonna stop before I step in it.
translation.ja: そういうわけじゃ… 墓穴を掘る前に黙るわ

translation.en: But I missed the country.
Fresh air, open spaces.
translation.ja: 新鮮な空気に広い空間…

translation.en: -Listen, I was-- [sneezes] -Oh.
-Bless you. -Mmm.
You sure you're not getting sick?
No.
I'm fine. I never get sick.
translation.ja: 病気には かからない

translation.en: Can't believe I'm sick.
-[knocking] -It's open.
[sighs] I brought Dr. Corey on a house call.
-Ding-dong. -[chuckles]
Well, how'd you guys even know I was sick?
Peter and Manaaki told me you were coming down with something,
translation.ja: ピーターたちよ　それに―

translation.en: and then when you were a no-show at the farmer's market, I...
translation.ja: ファーマーズ･マーケットに 来なかった

translation.en: Why do you not have a hot cup of tea in your hand,
and why is that not on the stove?
Well, it turns out I can't fix a simple kitchen sink.
translation.ja: まだキッチンを 修理できないの

translation.en: -I was about to fill it in the tub. -Okay.
I'm here to fix this.
And give me a nice big "aah."
Ah, just as I suspected.
Ah, what do you suspect?
translation.ja: 思った通り つまり？

translation.en: The common cold.
Your immune system is run down.
Bed-rest and fluids are the only cure, I'm afraid.
translation.ja: 水を飲んで寝るしかない

translation.en: -Kia ora. -Manaaki.
Oh, love.
-Is it a cold? -Yeah, afraid so.
Drink this.
[sighs] Okay.
Oh, this... Wow.
Yeah, I called in a prescription for Peter's kūmara curry soup.
translation.ja: クマラのカレースープを 頼んでおいた

translation.en: -Spice is the trick to knock out the cold. -Yeah, a little spicy.
translation.ja: スパイスが効く からい

translation.en: -More. -Yeah.
[Jake] G'day!
Mm, Jake.
Did you guys come in a clown car?
Kitchen sink's still munted, eh?
Who ever could have told you that?
And a little something for your tea.
Helps with a sore throat. From my bees.
-Your bees? -Bees.
-Like buzzing bees? -Uh, yeah, bees.
translation.ja: ハチを飼ってるの？ そうだ

translation.en: I'm gonna have a squiz at your kitchen sink.
Fever dream.
Oh, Jake, wait.
[sighs] You guys...
I'm running low on cash.
Gabriela, love, no.
translation.ja: ガブリエラ　違うよ

translation.en: Yeah, I'm not here on a job. It's okay.
We're here because we're your mates.
As long as you're here, you’re whānau.
translation.ja: ここに居る限り家族(ファウナ)だ

translation.en: One of us. And we look after our own.
translation.ja: 仲間だから互いに助け合う

translation.en: Here.
Now, off to bed, young lady.
translation.ja: さあ　早く寝なさい

translation.en: Come on.
He's so cute when he talks sternly.
translation.ja: 強い口調が可愛いでしょ？

translation.en: Jake.
[Gabriela] That was so good.
Tino pai.
translation.ja: ティノパイ(上手だった)

translation.en: -I said it right, right? -Yeah, you did.
Okay, good.
-They're so cute. -Thank you.
Oh, Gabriela! Did you care to buy a raffle ticket?
translation.ja: ガブリエラ 抽選券はいかが？

translation.en: Oh, uh, let me see.
Oh, do you have change for a twenty?
No, I don't,
but it's for a worthy cause, so there you go.
translation.ja: でも払う価値はあるわ どうぞ

translation.en: -Okay, thanks. -Anytime. Hey...
translation.ja: ありがとう いいのよ そう言えば考えてくれた？

translation.en: have you given any thought to my offer?
translation.ja: いいのよ そう言えば考えてくれた？

translation.en: I spoke to my husband, and we could wire some money through.
Charlotte, I'm...
I'm gonna turn it down.
Come again?
I'm just not willing to give up on my dream.
At least not yet.
Can we still be friends?
Don't give it a moment's thought.
Oh! Sorry.
Is that a yes?
[Jake] Let's go. Oh!
Come on, Tim! I've coached you for five seasons, man.
translation.ja: ５シーズンも教えたのに 外すか？

translation.en: What do they teach you in that fancy university, huh?
translation.ja: 大学で何を教わってる？ 大学で何を教わってる？ 〝ダンク･タンク〞

translation.en: Well, well, well, if it isn't the American. You care to test your skills?
translation.ja: 〝ダンク･タンク〞 アメリカ人が来たぞ 腕試しする？

translation.en: Just wanted to say thank you for helping fix my sink and my window, Jake.
translation.ja: シンクの修理ありがとう ジェイク

translation.en: Around here, I go by Chief Taylor.
translation.ja: テイラー消防隊長だよ

translation.en: You're a fireman?
A volunteer firefighter. Yeah, we all are.
translation.ja: みんな任意の消防士さ

translation.en: Okay, Chief Taylor. Um, I was hoping to talk to you about a proposition?
translation.ja: では隊長どの あなたに提案があるの

translation.en: [Jake] A proposition?
As you can see, I'm a little preoccupied at the moment,
translation.ja: 見ての通り忙しいんだ

translation.en: but if you care to make a donation, I might be able to give you a minute.
translation.ja: 献金してくれたら １分あげるよ

translation.en: If not, I might schedule you in next week. Maybe.
translation.ja: ダメなら 来週まで待ってくれ

translation.en: Next week? You're looking for trouble, aren't you?
translation.ja: 来週ってケンカ売ってる？

translation.en: Trouble from who?
A girl who can't work a clutch to save her--
-[Jake] Oh. That was pretty good. -[man 3] Nice shot.
Where'd you learn to throw like that?
Well, I was the pitcher for my high school softball team.
translation.ja: 高校時代はソフトボールの ピッチャーだったの

translation.en: Full of surprises.
Yeah, well, if you think that's a surprise, try this.
translation.ja: もっと驚くかもよ 聞いて

translation.en: How would you like to collaborate on the Bellbird?
translation.ja: 改修を手伝ってくれない？

translation.en: Thank you.
Thanks.
What's made you change your mind?
[clears throat] I'm learning that there is a difference between someone thinking I'm helpless
translation.ja: 救いようがないと 思っていた人が―

translation.en: and someone genuinely offering me help.
-Go ahead. All right, say it. -What? "Told you so."
translation.ja: 言ってもいいわ “ほら見ろ”ってね

translation.en: Ah, yeah. No. I've...
I've learned the hard way that you don't like being told what to do.
translation.ja: 君に口を出すと大変だからな

translation.en: And besides...
it'd start this partnership off on the wrong foot.
translation.ja: 最初から険悪なのはご免だ

translation.en: Wait, so...
So that means you'll do it?
Yeah.
So, how do we make this partnership work?
Well, what's your plan?
To stay?
Or go back to San Francisco when the Bellbird's back on her feet?
translation.ja: 軌道に乗ったら帰国する？

translation.en: Well, I do have my real life to get back to.
translation.ja: 生活はあっちにあるからね

translation.en: Oh, your real life. Okay, got it.
Okay, we'll do the work 50/50, split the costs 50/50,
translation.ja: それなら仕事は半々で 費用も半分…

translation.en: and split the profit 50/50 when we sell it.
translation.ja: 売る時も半分にしよう

translation.en: Okay.
Sounds good to me, partner.
translation.ja: 賛成よ　パートナーさん

translation.en: Partner.
You cannot get rid of this stove.
This is not Little House on the Prairie. We need a modern kitchen.
translation.ja: 古臭いわ　モダンにしたい

translation.en: This is a work of art, princess. All right? It's a Waterford Stanley wood burner from Ireland.
translation.ja: ウォーターフォードの 薪ストーブは芸術品だぞ

translation.en: That's nearly 400 kgs of steel.
Four-hundred... Whatever. I don't do the metric system.
translation.ja: 400キロって？ ポンドしか分からない

translation.en: Listen, like your kitchen sink, just because something's munted...
translation.ja: シンクと同じで どこかが故障しても

translation.en: -Mm-hmm. -...it doesn't mean it can't be fixed.
You've gotta work with what you have here in New Zealand. Don't touch--
translation.ja: この国では物を捨てない 触るなよ

translation.en: Brilliant.
You see? Broken.
The fireplace is pure, original craftsmanship. The woodwork alone, it tells a story.
translation.ja: 職人の手作りだ 木彫りも歴史を物語ってる

translation.en: Yeah, a story that says, "Replace me. I'm old and a fire hazard."
translation.ja: “古いから入れかえて”と 語ってる

translation.en: -It's time to drag Bellbird Valley... -Going swimmingly so far, I see.
translation.ja: 新しくすべき… とんとん拍子って感じ

translation.en: I can't quite make out if they're meant to fall in love or kill each other.
translation.ja: 恋に落ちるか殺し合うか

translation.en: Maybe both.
How exciting.
[Jake] Solar panels?
That'll ruin the inn's original charm.
translation.ja: ホテルの魅力を損なう

translation.en: Drink this in.
Glorious sunshine.
Ah, yes.
I want to fuel the inn with the warmth and the power of the sun.
translation.ja: 太陽の力でホテルを暖めたい

translation.en: What's more soulful than that?
Sledge-hammering should be the new self-care.
It's pretty therapeutic. Good job.
-Wait, wait, wait! Stop! -What?
It looks like...
old letters.
Well, they're... love letters.
But what are they doing stuffed inside a wall?
Uh, old custom.
Concealing or burying items in the structure of the house.
translation.ja: 壁の中に物を隠したり 埋めたりする

translation.en: So... enlighten me.
Okay.
Well, it's called immurement.
So the ancient Egyptians would...
leave artifacts entombed in the pyramid walls with the pharaohs.
translation.ja: 王墓であるピラミッドに 遺物を埋めた

translation.en: Some say it's superstition. Some say it's good luck.
translation.ja: 幸運を祈る行為だけど 迷信と言う人もいる

translation.en: But I say it's a thread... linking the past to the future.
translation.ja: 俺は過去と現在をつなぐ 糸だと思う

translation.en: A house...
A house remembers everyone who ever lived in it.
What?
You were gazing.
No, I wasn't.
Yeah, you were.
Wistfully.
[softly] I don't do wistfully.
[whispers] Yes, you do.
Do you need a moment? I can get you some tissues.
translation.ja: ティッシュを 持ってこようか？

translation.en: You're having fun with this, aren't you?
-Kinda. -Kinda.
Do you think it's snooping because we were looking at these letters?
Oh, okay. So now someone's getting a soft spot for dusty, old history, eh?
translation.ja: ほこりを被った古い手紙に 情が芽生えたか

translation.en: LEDs are 80% more energy efficient.
[giggles] Sweet as.
-Oh, look at you, adopting the lingo, eh? -[chuckles] Yeah, I'm trying.
translation.ja: こっちの言葉を覚えた？ 学んでる

translation.en: Also, wait. When we redo the sink and the counter...
translation.ja: シンクとカウンターを 修理したら…

translation.en: Yeah?
...can we reinstall...
this? Ta-da!
What about your fancy, new faucet?
translation.ja: 新しい蛇口が よかったんだろ？

translation.en: Oh, it'll take all of five minutes to swap it out for this beaut.
translation.ja: ５分で 取りかえられるでしょ？

translation.en: [Jake] Man...
Wow, you really like your faucets, don't you?
translation.ja: よほど気に入ってるのね

translation.en: Shelley, where's my fertilizer? I already checked out the back.
translation.ja: シェリー 私の肥料がないわよ

translation.en: Charlotte.
It seems I'm sold out, but I will rush-order you in some more.
translation.ja: 売り切れみたい すぐに発注するわ

translation.en: Out? It's my special-order fertilizer. Who else buys it?
translation.ja: 売り切れって 私の特注よ 誰が買うの？

translation.en: I have known you since kindergarten.
translation.ja: 幼稚園からの仲でしょ？

translation.en: We're Beechwood Downs, born and raised.
Gabriela is an outsider, an interloper, and you just... You give her my fertilizer?
translation.ja: ガブリエラはよそ者なのに 私の肥料を売るの？

translation.en: It's brand-name poop, love. There's enough to go around.
translation.ja: 商品だけどウンチよ いくらでもある

translation.en: Those two look very cozy. I thought she had a bloke back in the States.
translation.ja: いい感じね アメリカの男は？

translation.en: Oh, Dean?
No, no, they're splitsville.
I mean, they're still in touch,
and, you know, she could be pining just a little bit, but I don't think that's gonna...
translation.ja: 少しは未練が ありそうだけど…

translation.en: What?
No, I know that look. Charlotte. Don't go stirring up trouble.
translation.ja: 何か企んでる顔ね 余計なことしないでよ

translation.en: -Me? -Yes.
Never.
[Jake] It's starting to come together.
[Gabriela] These tiles match perfectly.
translation.ja: このタイルはピッタリ

translation.en: [Jake] They're manufactured from the same era. I got 'em online at Trade Me.
translation.ja: 同じ時代に作られた物を ネットで探した

translation.en: Huh, look at you, embracing technology.
translation.ja: テクノロジーも使うのね

translation.en: All right. There's hope for you yet.
Uh-oh. Want to help a girl grout?
translation.ja: ダメだわ　助けてくれる？

translation.en: Because I cannot smooth this out.
No, you've gotta go... So, just go...
Yeah, this way.
And then, just... that's it.
translation.ja: ほら　こうすればいい

translation.en: [Jake] Yeah.
Like that.
You're right. She's a beaut.
translation.ja: この暖炉は美しいわね

translation.en: She sure is.
What's that?
My gray water recycler.
Yeah, it treats and reuses the dishwasher water as drip irrigation for our new garden.
translation.ja: 台所の排水を浄化して 野菜畑にまくの

translation.en: Ugh, that's disgusting.
Wouldn't you want clean water for your veggies? Come on.
translation.ja: 野菜にはキレイな水を

translation.en: Uh, that's the point.
The recycler cleans the water.
You're messing with me, aren't you?
Easy target.
No, the gray water recycler... I'm into it.
translation.ja: 俺は中水再生タンクの虜(とりこ)だよ

translation.en: Good. Me too. It's not going anywhere.
Ah, it seems Gilbert's into it, too.
translation.ja: あいつも楽しみだとさ

translation.en: Gilbert!
[Gabriela] Where are we going?
[Jake] To my place. We need to get some tools. Be there in another ten.
translation.ja: 俺の家だ　道具を取りに行く

translation.en: [woman on radio] ...in the hive by collecting a sample.
translation.ja: ハチの巣から採取します

translation.en: There are two methods...
What is this?
"Buzzworthy." Beekeeping news.
translation.ja: 養蜂家向けのニュース

translation.en: It's very informative.
So much information on there.
Okay, can I cha-- I'm changing it.
Oh, gosh.
You can turn it.
Hey, you... It's your car, I told you.
translation.ja: 君の車だから好きにしろ

translation.en: -This is the best thing I could find. -You didn't look very hard.
translation.ja: これしかない もっと探せよ

translation.en: [Jake] Wow, that's a happening song, and I like it.
translation.ja: こりゃ ノリがいい曲だな

translation.en: -[Gabriela] It's my jam now. -It's your jam now?
translation.ja: 気に入った 気に入った？

translation.en: -[Gabriela] Yes! -Thought you didn't like it.
All righty.
Well...
This is it.
[Gabriela] Wow.
This is great.
Yeah, my gran built it in the '60s.
You know, you remind me a bit of my gran.
-Really? -Mm-hmm.
Is it because of my pioneer woman spirit?
Because you're both impossible. Come on.
translation.ja: 我がままだ 来いよ

translation.en: Home sweet home.
Cozy.
Taxidermy?
Is that a... stuffed possum, or is there something I need to worry about, Jake?
translation.ja: ポッサムのぬいぐるみじゃ ないとしたら なんで？

translation.en: My gran had one vendetta, possums.
And that fella right there ate all of her avocados, so... [chuckles]
translation.ja: 庭のアボカドを 食い荒らすから―

translation.en: Well, she trapped him, and she got her revenge.
translation.ja: ワナを仕掛けて復讐を

translation.en: Well, you definitely made this place a home.
translation.ja: 快適に暮らしてるのね

translation.en: I moved out here after Megan passed.
It's okay. I'm pretty confident someone in town spilled the beans.
translation.ja: いいんだ 町の誰かに聞いたろ？

translation.en: Yeah.
Yeah.
Uh, Megan...
She didn't like the rural life. It was...
It was too far out for her. So we'd been renting a place in town.
translation.ja: 彼女には最果ての地だ それで町に部屋を借りた

translation.en: But after she died, I just...
came back.
Yeah, I was in the mood to be alone for a while.
I'm really sorry.
Yeah, me too.
I'm guessing the universe has its own plans for things, eh?
translation.ja: 天の配剤ってやつかな

translation.en: Yes, it does.
Anyway. [clears throat] Right. This is it.
-Let's do it. -Okay.
When you said solar panels, I kept imagining huge and ugly.
translation.ja: 太陽光パネルは もっと ごついと思ってた

translation.en: Well, the best thing about technology is it's ever-evolving. Mm-hmm.
translation.ja: テクノロジーは 進化するからいいのよ

translation.en: These panels will help power the inn and they won't compromise curb appeal.
translation.ja: 電気を供給しながら 外観を損なわない

translation.en: I've gotta admit, it's pretty cool.
Wait, what was that?
-What? -Was that you admitting defeat?
[groans] How is gracious acceptance considered defeat?
translation.ja: 受け入れただけなのに 負けかよ

translation.en: -Ooh, yeah. -Settle down.
-[Gabriela chuckles] -All right, I'll give Norman a call up so he and his boys can haul away this junk.
translation.ja: ノーマンに ゴミを運んでもらおう

translation.en: Ooh, FYI, he goes by Norm now.
translation.ja: 待って　今は“ノーム”よ

translation.en: -Yeah, of course he does. -[chuckles] Get it right.
translation.ja: そうだろうな 正しくね

translation.en: Are you okay?
-Hey, you all right? -It was, um...
It was... It was a snake.
A snake...
Y-You mean that snake?
Yeah, fun fact about New Zealand,
there are no snakes.
-Yeah. -[chuckles]
Thanks for breaking my fall.
Anytime.
-I'll go check on that railing. -Yeah.
translation.ja: 手すりを見てくる ああ

translation.en: I thought we were friends, mate.
Hey, hey! Ah, ah, ah! No fly zone.
translation.ja: ダメだ　領空侵犯だぞ

translation.en: This is my area of total artistic expression. -[Gabriela chuckles] -Okay?
translation.ja: ここは俺が芸術性を 発揮するエリアだ

translation.en: All right, go ahead.
-Go ahead. -Let your inner Picasso out.
Thank you.
You know what? What do you reckon? Finished for the day?
translation.ja: 今日の作業は ここまでにする？

translation.en: [sighs] I reckon we've earned a beer.
-[Gabriela grunts] -Yeah, me too. Thank you.
translation.ja: そうだな　ありがとう

translation.en: [whispering] Wow.
-[Gabriela] Here you go. -Cheers.
[Gabriela] So...
this...
-Your place. -[Jake] Yeah.
What's with you and the, uh... the old houses, huh? Is that like your thing?
translation.ja: 古い家に関わるのは 好きだから？

translation.en: Well, I always took to building since I was a little fella.
translation.ja: ガキの頃から建物が好きだ

translation.en: You know, creating something from nothing.
And after...
Megan was gone, and after I finished the reno at gran's place, I, uh...
translation.ja: ばあさんの家に戻って リノベをした後―

translation.en: I found I liked fixing broken things the most.
translation.ja: 修理が好きだと気付いた

translation.en: You know, the buildings others gave up on.
translation.ja: 誰かが放棄した建物のね

translation.en: It's hard yakka, but...
Yeah, it makes me feel a little, uh, less...
A little less broken?
Yeah.
Something like that.
Go on.
I spilled my guts. It's your turn.
translation.ja: 俺は話した　君の番だ

translation.en: Okay.
Well, as I'm sure you've probably pieced together,
translation.ja: 何となく気付いてると 思うけど…

translation.en: things weren't so stellar back in San Francisco.
translation.ja: シスコでの生活は空回り

translation.en: I had a low point, by which I mean...
days of me laying on my couch in pajamas,
translation.ja: 毎日パジャマで ゴロゴロしてた

translation.en: drowning my sorrows in pralines and cream
translation.ja: アイスで悲しみを紛らわせ

translation.en: and way too much wine.
I entered a "Win an Inn" contest.
And as you would say, it's been hard yakka.
translation.ja: それで この重労働！

translation.en: No, seriously.
This place has really grown on me. I'm gonna miss it.
translation.ja: ここを離れるのは寂しいわ

translation.en: You know what?
Clearly, New Zealand hasn't done her job convincing you to stay, but...
translation.ja: この国の魅力が まだ伝わってないらしい

translation.en: but we can fix that, so I'm declaring tomorrow a holiday.
translation.ja: それを正そう　明日は休みだ

translation.en: Okay.
A day off. What, you don't have those in America?
translation.ja: 休日だ　アメリカ人にはない

translation.en: No, we do, it's just we don't really take them,
you know, with the whole career hamster wheel and all.
translation.ja: キャリアアップのためよ

translation.en: Right. Well, I'll pick you up early. Wear your togs, okay?
translation.ja: 朝迎えに来る　水着を

translation.en: -Togs? -Yeah, your togs.
And get some real boots, not those fashion ones.
translation.ja: それとブーツだ しゃれたのじゃなく

translation.en: Ones you can tramp in.
So, is this like a date with Jake?
translation.ja: ジェイクと デートするわけね？

translation.en: [giggles] I'm not sure, but we're tramping.
translation.ja: さあね　歩くらしいわ

translation.en: Whatever that means.
-[laughs] -But what about you?
